subject: Marketing
title: Jargon Is a Barrier
description: One-minute skill: Jargon Is a Barrier.

hook.text: 'Leverage our synergistic solutions to optimize ROI.' Nobody knows what that means. Nobody cares.

buildup.text: Jargon makes writers feel smart but makes readers feel excluded and confused.

discovery.text: Plain language increases trust because it signals that the writer has nothing to hide.

twist.text: Studies show jargon-heavy writing is rated as less trustworthyâ€”not more professional.

climax.text: The goal of copy isn't to impress. It's to communicate clearly and persuade effectively.

punchline.text: If you need jargon to explain it, you don't understand it.

quiz.question: How does jargon affect reader trust?
options: It decreases trust because it signals obscurity
It increases trust by demonstrating expertise
Jargon has no measurable effect on reader perception
